Class AV.SearchSortBuilder


Defined in: av.js.

Class Summary
Constructor Attributes Constructor Name and Description
 
AV.SearchSortBuilder()
A builder to generate sort string for app searching.For example: 

  var builder = new AV.SearchSortBuilder();
  builder.ascending('key1').descending('key2','max');
  var query = new AV.SearchQuery('Player');
  query.sortBy(builder);
  query.find().then .
Method Summary
Method Attributes Method Name and Description
 
ascending(key, mode, missing)
Sorts the results in ascending order by the given key and options.
 
build()
Build a sort string by configuration.
 
descending(key, mode, missing)
Sorts the results in descending order by the given key and options.
 
whereNear(key, point, options)
Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point values near the point given.
Class Detail
AV.SearchSortBuilder()
A builder to generate sort string for app searching.For example: 

  var builder = new AV.SearchSortBuilder();
  builder.ascending('key1').descending('key2','max');
  var query = new AV.SearchQuery('Player');
  query.sortBy(builder);
  query.find().then ...
Since:
0.5.1
Method Detail
{AV.SearchSortBuilder} ascending(key, mode, missing)
Sorts the results in ascending order by the given key and options.
Parameters:
{String} key
The key to order by.
{String} mode
The sort mode, default is 'avg', you can choose 'max' or 'min' too.
{String} missing
The missing key behaviour, default is 'last', you can choose 'first' too.
Returns:
{AV.SearchSortBuilder} Returns the builder, so you can chain this call.
{String} build()
Build a sort string by configuration.
Returns:
{String} the sort string.
{AV.SearchSortBuilder} descending(key, mode, missing)
Sorts the results in descending order by the given key and options.
Parameters:
{String} key
The key to order by.
{String} mode
The sort mode, default is 'avg', you can choose 'max' or 'min' too.
{String} missing
The missing key behaviour, default is 'last', you can choose 'first' too.
Returns:
{AV.SearchSortBuilder} Returns the builder, so you can chain this call.
{AV.SearchSortBuilder} whereNear(key, point, options)
Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point values near the point given.
Parameters:
{String} key
The key that the AV.GeoPoint is stored in.
{AV.GeoPoint} point
The reference AV.GeoPoint that is used.
{Object} options
The other options such as mode,order, unit etc.
Returns:
{AV.SearchSortBuilder} Returns the builder, so you can chain this call.
